page.title: 12TREGONY IN THE 1890'S CONT..
page.content: THE ESTIMATED DAMAGE WAS OVER 4,000 POUNDS. THREE NEW HOUSES AND A BUNGALOW HAVE BEEN BUILT SINCE THE '90'S' EXCEPT 'THE CRESCENT' VERY LITTLE CHANGE HAS TAKEN PLACE IN FORE STREET. RESTORED BUILDINGS WERE IN 1898/9 ST CUBY CHURCH AND IN 1895 THE ALMSHOUSES. WHEN THE SCHOOL WAS BUILT IN 1877, 130 TO 140 PUPILS AND 3 TEACHERS ATTENDED. AT 12 OR 14 ALL HAD TO FIND A JOB. CUBY HOUSE WAS A HIGH SCHOOL FOR GIRLS. ONLY TWO THATCHED COTTAGES REMAIN. THE COBBLED STREETS, THE BLOCKED WINDOWS AND ALL THE ROWS OF BACK-TO- BACK TWO-ROOMED COTTAGES HAVE GONE TOO.
